name: Lowestoft Fibre Network
description:
This project involved a Fibre to the Home (FTTH) network, covering 30,000 homes with both underground and overhead installations serviced via the Fibre Exchange.

Scope of Work:
- Installation and excavation of public highways, footways, and private land.
- Installation of fibre optic cables in new and existing highways.
- Ductwork and cable installations in public and private buildings.
- Street cabinet installations and overhead pole access.

Pod-Trak focused on risk control by updating the Project Hazard Register, ensuring high-quality delivery with an excellent Health & Safety record. Close engagement with the local authority helped minimize disruption to the public and businesses.

Key Stats:
- Excavation of 180,000m of track.
- Delivered on time and within budget, leading to another major project award.

name: NWEP Phase 3 Cable Containment
description:
APT were contracted to install 15km of cable containment throughout the North West Electrification phase 4 project.

Scope of Work:
- Installation of raised GRP troughing.
- Wall-tied tunnel and bridge containment.
- TTS ground-laid troughing.

The majority of the works were completed during short night-time possessions, with our in-house road rail plant delivering materials across the project site. Our team worked in strict adherence to Health & Safety regulations, ensuring a safe environment for all. Programming and planning large teams and equipment was essential in completing the project on time and within budget.

Key Stats:
- 15km of cable containment installed.
- Delivered within the budget.
- Project completed on time between July 2017 and October 2018.
quote: Installation of 15km of cable containment throughout NWEP phase 4

name: North West Electrification Boundary Fencing
description:
Pod-Trak were contracted to install over 3km of palisade boundary fencing as part of the North West Electrification Phase 3 project.

Scope of Work:
- Installation of 1.8m high palisade fencing along the Network Rail boundary.
- Works conducted in stages between Blackpool and Preston during the completion of the North West Electrification project.
- Use of rope access in challenging locations to install fencing at height.
- Materials were delivered throughout the route using our in-house plant.

Key Achievements:
- Strict adherence to Health & Safety regulations, ensuring a safe environment for both workers and the public.
- Project completed within budget and on time, between February 2018 and January 2019.

name: Switching Access and Stairways
description:
APT was contracted to complete the installation of safe access to allow staff to reach overhead line switching equipment across the North West Electrification Phase 3 and 4 projects.

Scope of Work:
- Construction of access stairways and walkways throughout the NWEP, providing seamless and secure access to critical switching points between Blackpool and Manchester.
- All works were carried out midweek, minimizing disruption to rail services and ensuring continuous project flow.
- Use of bespoke construction techniques, allowing our teams to safely navigate and install in complex rail environments.

Key Achievements:
- Delivered within a tight timeframe from July 2018 to December 2018, meeting all project milestones.
- Rigorous adherence to Health & Safety regulations ensured a zero-incident project, further strengthening our reputation for safe, efficient project delivery.
- The project was completed on budget at £300k, showcasing our commitment to cost-effective solutions.

APT’s ability to work in challenging environments, coupled with the satisfaction of the project’s completion, resulted in positive feedback and paved the way for further opportunities.

name: Blackpool Lighting Walkway
description:
APT was contracted to complete the installation of a lighting walkway in Blackpool. The project involved providing safe, well-lit access to critical areas of the railway infrastructure.

Scope of Work:
- Installation of energy-efficient lighting along key pathways, ensuring safety and accessibility for staff and passengers.
- All work was performed during tight night-time schedules to avoid disruption to railway operations.
- The project involved bespoke construction techniques to navigate complex rail environments and install lighting fixtures safely and securely.

Key Achievements:
- Delivered on time and within budget, with the project completed between June 2019 and October 2019.
- Strict adherence to Health & Safety regulations, resulting in a zero-incident project.

APT’s ability to deliver in challenging environments, coupled with a strong commitment to Health & Safety, made this project a success and strengthened our partnership with the client.
quote: Installation of lighting walkway in Blackpool
